Article.ArticleTitle: <sup>222</sup>Rn and its relation with meteorological conditions and gaseous pollutants in the outdoor environment of Qena City South of Egypt.

AbstractText: In the outdoor environment of Qena city, located in southern Egypt, <sup>222</sup>Rn concentrations were continuously measured from January 2015 to December 2015 using Alpha-Guard radon monitor, PQ 2000 PRO. Meteorological parameters (air temperature AT, relative humidity RH, and evaporation rate EV) and gaseous pollutants [ozone O<sub>3</sub>, nitrogen oxide NO<sub>x</sub>, and particulate matter that has a diameter of less than 10 µm (PM<sub>10</sub>)] data for the same period were collected from the meteorological station. This work aims to study the potential relationships between <sup>222</sup>Rn and each of the meteorological parameters and gaseous pollutants. According to observational data, the yearly average concentrations of <sup>222</sup>Rn were 19.35 ± 1.58 Bq/m<sup>3</sup>, 31.68 ± 1.97 µg/m<sup>3</sup> for O<sub>3</sub>, 9.97 ± 2.27 µg/m<sup>3</sup> for NO<sub>x</sub>, and 109.95 ± 6.48 µg/m<sup>3</sup> for PM<sub>10</sub>. The concentration of <sup>222</sup>Rn is positively correlated with relative humidity, nitrogen oxide, and particulate matter, whereas it is negatively correlated with air temperature, evaporation rate, and ozone. Descriptive statistical analysis revealed various distribution patterns for <sup>222</sup>Rn, meteorological parameters, and gaseous pollutants.
